Conventional three-electrode cells were employed for
ﬁlm electrodes were used as the working electrodes. The
counter electrode was a platinum or magnesium foil.
The reference electrode had a silver wire immersed in
solution with two liquid junctions with microporous
glass membranes to avoid contamination of the Ag
into the electrolyte solution. A 1.0 mol L
(Kishida) was used as the electrolyte solution. We also prepared

In order to characterize the passivation layer at the surface
thin ﬁlm electrode, we conducted X-ray photo
electron spectroscopy: XPS (ESCA3400, Shimadzu) with Mg-K
radiation. As a comparison, the XPS spectra for a magnesium
metal thin ﬁlm was also measured. The Mg
Powder XRD patterns and the crystal structures of
. The brown symbols are measured value of the PXRD data, the dark
green line is the simulated pattern. The light green marks represents the peak positions and the blue line is corresponding to the residue.
